intro: Scariola longidentata, commonly known as the long-toothed scariola, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
